name: Traders Hotel, Kuala Lumpur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dear management,
reviews.title: Hard Beds and Given Smoke Smelling Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I'd like to bring to your attention some major short comings of your hotel. My husband and I decided to splurge while in Kuala Lumpur and choose your hotel to treat ourselves while on our trip around the world. Unfortunately you did not meet our basic expectations.
reviews.title: Not to be miss!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked through hotels.com and prepaid for a Non smoking Traders Room with a Towers view with a king sized bed. We did not receive this at all.
reviews.title: Unique view of the Petronas Twin Towers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got to the hotel and tried to check in on the 5th floor, after waiting in line and being looked up in the system, we were escorted to the elevator to go to the 32nd floor to check in. (This seems like a waste of time in my opinion, since we clearly could have checked in right away instead of going to a different floor.)
reviews.title: Stunning location and fabulous rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got to the 32nd floor and had to wait in line again, there were 2 people handling check in with 2 other customers and another guy in front of us waiting. It was around 3pm. We had to wait over 15 minutes here just to check in, and there's only 1 seat at the desk for each party... What is that about? The wife has to stand and hold the luggage?
reviews.title: Towering success

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a heavy journey from the UK to KL we were met out of the taxi and taken straight up to our room where we checked in. After 5 minutes we were done! The room was lovely - on the 30th floor, overlooking the towers. The facilities and amenities in the room was super. Very comfortable and good turn down service in the evenings.
reviews.title: Amazing stay at Traders Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: We ate breakfast at Gobi Chit Chat and my husband said it was the best breakfast spread he has ever seen! The food was allcooked fresh, nothing was cold or soggy like in some buffet places and the service was second to none.
reviews.title: Great hotel, with that special personalised service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did pay for the Club Lounge and it was well worth it! The staff there were really friendly and knew us after one day. The drinks between 5-7pm were definitely worth the extra cost, especially after having a bottle of wine on one occasion in the Sky bar! The buffet food was fresh, and changed every day too.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall, if we ever come back to KL this hotel is on the list as it was a highlight of our stay :)
reviews.title: Very stylish hotel in perfect location in KL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love this hotel. I had arrived late due to a delayed flight, I was so tired. Upon arrival I was instantly warmly greeted by the staff and immediately taken to my room on the 30th floor. The staff member took me to my room and we quickly and effortlessly filled out the paperwork. I was so grateful for this, because I was in no mood to be waiting around in a foyer.
reviews.title: Clean comfortable and smokers rejoice! ;o)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hadn't stayed at Traders before, "preferring" the Shangri-La hotels in Malaysia, which we always use. We needn't have worried - this was our first time visit to Traders and will certainly not be the last. You get what you would expect from a member of the Shangri-La group - world class service from excellent staff who really make the difference from your stay being ordinary to exceptional.
reviews.title: FABULOUS TRADERS!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do yourself a favour! Try Traders for that feeling of special treatment and being pampered!!
reviews.title: Perfect location and perfect service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Mr & Mrs James Thomson
reviews.title: The staff is what truly gives this hotel a 5 star rating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After staying at the Renaissance Hotel in KL on our way through on the way to other destinations in Malaysia, we thought that it would be hard to to better the service and facilities but the Traders won hands down. We stayed for 2 nights at the end of our Malaysian adventure and were so impressed with the service and the facilities that we would return to the Traders anytime in the future.
reviews.title: For first timers in KL, dont pass up a stay at Traders!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked a Traders Club room on the 25th Floor, which had an absolutely fabulous view of the Twin Towers (see photos). Upon arrival we were immediately escorted to the 32nd floor for priority check-in and offered a complimentary cocktail, which we gladly accepted.
reviews.title: Fantastic - almost perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Very modern hotel, excellent service, great location and FREE internet and that is the way it should be. Loved having out at the pool area with the stunning views. I found this hotel with the help of the reviews here and so appriciate it.
reviews.title: I can only agree with the reviews here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I am sure you will all be happy here, really cant think of anything I could have asked for they did not supply.
reviews.title: Worth the price you pay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Service was good and buffet breakfast was excellent.
reviews.title: great hotel to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: View from the park view room was excellent.
reviews.title: Excellent stay. Great Value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free internet access which is easy to use.
reviews.title: A very good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: The receptionist checked me in whilst talking on the phone, I told her I thought it wasn't very professional, do one or the other not both! I had a stop over so wasnt too bothered about the room but thought it was very average, stained carpet and a well worn look about it. The concierge told me it would take 3 hours to get to the airport by taxi - it took 50 mins, so all in all it was a waste of time and money staying at Traders- would have been better off staying somewhere cheaper and a bit friendlier.
reviews.title: average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room had the best view of the Petronas twin towers. Every aspect of the room was superb. I will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd never been to KL before so there were no expectations. Flew in at 7am and arrived at the hotel about 8.15am. We had upgraded our booking to the traders club room as advised by previous trip advisors. Best ever. Check in on 32nd floor ( only for traders club check in's) given a complimentary breakfast as our room wasn't ready & they were very apologetic. Our room was on the 29th floor overlooking the Petronas towers & park
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - great views. Afternoon tea was supplied & lavish. Cocktail hour free every night. Great facilities, great service, very helpful. Would definately stay there again.
reviews.title: It's very very very good hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Traders hotel has made a very good impression and I can recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Great hotel with great service and everything within the building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 6 nights in the beginning of Spetmeber, unfortunately I came down with a cold/flu the second day we were there and ended up spending a lot of time in the room. We booked Club level - city view, the room was large and very modern and nice, nothing to complain about, the bathroom was very elegant, a nice touch. In the times that I was able to venture out coming back to the hotel was sooooo nice, KL can be so humid and in some places dirty, it was wonderful to be able to come back to the clean fresh hotel. We tried to eat just at the hotel and the food was pretty good, the breakfast in the club lounge was very nice and the drinks and canapes in the afternoon were good to, just remember no bacon in Malaysia. I had some pasta one night in the downstairs restaurant and wasn't very impressed, but pasta isn't exactly known as a forte of Malaysia. The only thing that would have been better is some cheaper and more varied room service food items, because I was so sick I barely had the energy to go outside the room to eat, not having much on the in room menu didnt help me, I probably could have asked for them to make something, but it would be nice if it was already on the menu. Overall a great hotel, I'm glad we stayed there, it was easy to get to everything we mostly went by taxi. The shuttle/buggy that the hotel provide to Suria shopping centre is very handy too. The drinks at the Skybar are extremely pricey, we only went once, it would be nice to have spent more time up there but we couldnt justify the prices.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: All in all a great hotel, we would definitely stay again if/when we go back.
reviews.title: Worth it for the view... Bonus points for the breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Traders for six nights in November, 2010. I'll give you the quick summary first, then go into more detail for those who want it.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel - except for food poisoning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010
reviews.text: HIGHS:
reviews.title: Managing expectations
Amazing view from guest room
reviews.text: 1. The View - I paid for a Club-Level Twin Towers View room. It was absolutely worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Definition of Shangri-La : Eden -any place of complete bliss and delight and peace .
reviews.title: I Found my Shangri-La!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the only way to describe The Traders Hotel. Even though it is managed by the Shangri-La, this hotel should be 5star rated and is much better than The Shangri-La down the road.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel, a true pleasure to stay in- must go for club lounge!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed at The Traders Hotel for 13 days in April, our travelling party thoroughly enjoyed our holiday due to the outstanding attention we received from staff during our visit. Never have we resided at a hotel with such impressive customer service skills. Since arriving back home, we have not stopped praising The Traders Hotel. The staff that helped us find our Shangri-La were:Mohan, Yogi of Concierge, Junior, Weng Hoe, Kylie Xia, James from Club Lounge, Maria from Gobo ChitChat, Eddy, Lee and Jeffrey from GoboChitchat and Jared from Reservations on level 5.
reviews.title: Average at most - disappointing service and the building is showing its age...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are a compliment to the hotel, especially during April when it was at 99% occupancy (F1 and IT Fair), they were flawless, highly professional and nothing was ever too much trouble. Being a travel group of 10, they purposely went out of their way to accommodate us by arranging a large table in GoboChitChat for breatkfast and the Trader's Club Lounge. it is no surprise why fellow travellers on this website have rated it number one hotel in Kuala Lumpur.
reviews.title: 5* in name only

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We all had Park View Deluxe rooms and paid the extra 105RM per night for Trader's Club Lounge access. Definitely worth it, afternoon tea of sandwiches,warm scones(with jam and cream)tea, coffee and then the evening cocktails from 5.30pm until 7.30pm which consisted of 2xcocktails to chose from, spirits, several international wines and beer and a excellent selection of canapes (satay sticks, sushi, cheese platter, croquettes etc). I preferred breakfast on level 5 in GoboChitChat than the Club lounge as it has a better variety of fresh and delicious food - fresh fruit and salads, juice bar, japanese, western, curries, noodles, pastries etc. Also the use of the club lounge printer and computer is fully inclusive. Saves travelling with a laptop.
reviews.title: No1 for Twin Towers Petronas view in KL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had stayed at the Renaissance at the start of the hotel because it has a huge pool for the kids. At the end of the hotel I chose the hotel I wanted to stay in, which was the Traders. I liked the look of it from it the photos on its website. I wasn’t disappointed. The décor in the hotel is fantastic throughout. The staff were also very friendly.
reviews.title: Very stylish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid extra for Park View rooms. It seems a lot to pay extra for the view but it was worth it. You look out on the twin towers which look impressive by day and spectacular at night. The beds were the most comfortable we had in our holiday.
reviews.title: Cool and trendy - but some minor issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pool at the Traders was a disappointment to the kids. It is on the 31st floor with a view of the twin towers but we didn’t arrive until 7:30 in the evening by which time the pool was closed and had turned into a smart cocktail bar. I wonder how often a drunken reveller falls into the pool. We went up to the pool the next morning and it is lovely. It is 30m long and great for doing lengths. There are also two Jacuzzis by the pool which are surrounded by two ponds covered in floating vegetation (another trap for the unwary reveller).
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Traders Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast was great although I only had room to try a fraction of the food on offer. Maybe a longer stay would have given me a chance to run through the options.
reviews.title: Faultless Service - Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only gripe was the length of time it took to check out. The checkout system seemed incredibly long winded and the lady on reception had to go through a complicated rigmarole of applying balancing charges. When I asked to pay for the two rooms together this seemed to involve an even more complicated process. It looked like they needed some better software!
reviews.title: from heaven to a mess

aka: Traders Hotel, Kuala Lumpur Hotel Kuala Lumpur
description: Traders Hotel, Kuala Lumpur is a contemporary city centre hotel that caters to smart business and leisure travellers. This hotel in Kuala Lumpur offers 571 stylishly appointed rooms and suites in the heart of the city, just opposite the Petronas Twin Towers. Guest Rooms: Traders Hotel Kuala Lumpur offers value accommodation with a range of amenities and facilities combined with an exceptional level of service that is distinct from other KL hotels. Traders Club: Traders Club rooms offer an enhanced level of service, comfort, and convenience for busy travellers, including a personal concierge. All rooms on the Traders Club floors are non-smoking and have exclusive access to the Traders Club Lounge on level 32. Suites: Suites at Traders Hotel, Kuala Lumpur offer spacious and luxurious accommodations. All suites offer a separate sitting area that is perfect for relaxed business meetings, and a choice of dramatic park or city views.All our guests enjoy complimentary WiFi broadband access throughout the hotel premises and in the hotel limousine during airport transfers. It's the freedom smart Travellers know at Traders Hotel, Kuala Lumpur. Restaurants: Traders Hotel Kuala Lumpur provides a fine selection of restaurants in Kuala Lumpur to satisfy your culinary requirements. Enjoy some of the city’s best steaks in intimate elegance at Gobo Upstairs Lounge & Grill on level 6. For more casual dining and popular entertainment, sample Western and Asian fare under an animated light show at the Gobo Chit Chat on level 5. Lounges & Bars: Enjoy the creative cocktail list at the Gobo Upstairs Lounge. A tourist attraction in its own right the famous SkyBar is a cosmopolitan open-air rooftop cocktail bar and a must for any visit to KL. Happy hour runs from 11am - 9pm.
